messages.title: Pat's message to the Maidenhead Constituency
messages.content: I am very much a local, having grown up in Maidenhead. I attended local schools and, like most of us, rely on local services. I have a proven track record of service to the community, including youth club volunteering, and have been a member on White Waltham Parish Council since being elected in 1994. I'm very involved with our town's football team, having supported them since my schooldays. It would be my privilege to be your MP. Pat McDonald, Your Labour Party Candidate

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will build over a million new homes in five years, ensuring at least half of these are council homes for truly affordable rent.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A SECURE NHS AND SOCIAL CARE
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will halt health service privatisation and directly fund free care for those who need it, integrating these services into the NHS to ensure that they are there for all of us

keyPolicies.policyTitle: PUT THE PUBLIC BACK IN OUR ECONOMY & SERVICES
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will end the public services rip-off, train the teachers, doctors and nurses of the future, and make utilities and trains publicly owned.
We will build a new National Education Service (NES) for England to be phased in over a 10-year period. Under the NES, every child and adult will have the right to access to training and education.
We will give people stronger employment rights from day one in a job and require that working people are paid a wage that they can live on.

issues.education: A SECURE HOMES GUARANTEE: We will build over a million new homes in five years, ensuring at least half of these are council homes for truly affordable rent. A NATIONAL EDUCATION SERVICE: We will build a new National Education Service (NES) for England to be phased in over a 10-year period. Under the NES, every child and adult will have the right to access to training and education.
issues.health: A SECURE NHS AND SOCIAL CARE: We will halt health service privatisation and directly fund free care for those who need it, integrating these services into the NHS to ensure that they are there for all of us. The NHS services we need: Having used local hospitals myself, including St Mark's, I know how dedicated NHS staff are and how their work is valued, particularly by people receiving services. A future Labour Government will immediately halt the proposed closure of A&Es in England and other essential departments.
issues.labourEmployment: DIGNITY AT WORK: We will give people stronger employment rights from day one in a job and require that working people are paid a wage that they can live on.
issues.socialWelfare: The highest quality education for every child: Educated locally in Maidenhead, I know the value of good schools. We're committed to restoring maintenance grants for students so that no one is held back from realising their ambitions. Grammar schools will do nothing to help the overwhelming majority of children.

community.content: Let's eliminate the need for food banks: A few years ago, in an area of great affluence like the Maidenhead constituency, the idea of food banks would have been unthinkable. Now it's a reality. No-one can be unaware of the plight of the homeless in this area. Both are a disgrace in twenty-first century Britain.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am very much a local, having grown up in Maidenhead. I attended local schools and, like most of us, rely on local services. I have a proven track record of service to the community, including youth club volunteering, and have been a member on White Waltham Parish Council since being elected in 1994. I'm very involved with our town's football team, having supported them since my schooldays. It would be my privilege to be your MP. Pat McDonald, Your Labour Party Candidate

examples: We will build over a million new homes in five years, ensuring at least half of these are council homes for truly affordable rent.
We will halt health service privatisation and directly fund free care for those who need it, integrating these services into the NHS to ensure that they are there for all of us.
We will end the public services rip-off, train the teachers, doctors and nurses of the future, and make utilities and trains publicly owned.
We will build a new National Education Service (NES) for England to be phased in over a 10-year period. Under the NES, every child and adult will have the right to access to training and education.
We will give people stronger employment rights from day one in a job and require that working people are paid a wage that they can live on.

Let's eliminate the need for food banks: A few years ago, in an area of great affluence like the Maidenhead constituency, the idea of food banks would have been unthinkable. Now it's a reality. No-one can be unaware of the plight of the homeless in this area. Both are a disgrace in twenty-first century Britain.
We will build over a million new homes in five years, ensuring at least half of these are council homes for truly affordable rent.
We will halt health service privatisation and directly fund free care for those who need it, integrating these services into the NHS to ensure that they are there for all of us.
We will end the public services rip-off, train the teachers, doctors and nurses of the future, and make utilities and trains publicly owned.
We will build a new National Education Service (NES) for England to be phased in over a 10-year period. Under the NES, every child and adult will have the right to access to training and education.
We will give people stronger employment rights from day one in a job and require that working people are paid a wage that they can live on.

Let's eliminate the need for food banks: A few years ago, in an area of great affluence like the Maidenhead constituency, the idea of food banks would have been unthinkable. Now it's a reality. No-one can be unaware of the plight of the homeless in this area. Both are a disgrace in twenty-first century Britain.

On 8 June, families in the Maidenhead Constituency can choose between a Labour government that stands up for the many, or the Tories who only look after a privileged few. The Tories are holding people back. MAKE YOUR VOTE COUNT FOR THE MANY.
This election is a choice between a Labour Party who will build a Britain for the many, and a Conservative Party who stand only for the few.

The Tories stand only for the privileged few. For most people real term pay is still lower than before the economic crash, while the lucky few at the top are given tax breaks worth tens of billions of pounds
